sub_title: UX/UI Designer I Product Designer I Manufacturing & Automation I BMO Automation
summary:
I am currently undergoing an intensive Bootcamp from Springboard. During the Bootcamp, I will be trained as a UX/UI Designer. My passion is to develop aesthetically (UI Design) and functionally (UX Design) digital products to achieve user, business, and product goals.

The success of a user interface depends 50% on the UX process and 50% on industry knowledge. This is why I chose to specialize in manufacturing and automation.

I recently wrote, designed, and published a 168-page Technical Sales Manual for BMO Automation. This document contains all the expert knowledge in the automation of CNC machines.

I am currently working as a UX/UI Designer with a multidisciplinary team on BMO Xenon - A platform to dramatically improve manufacturing companies' productivity. It's great to see all my expertise in automated manufacturing now being applied to make BMO Xenon a success.

I enjoy having interesting conversations! So would you like to speak sometime about UX/UI Design, manufacturing, or automation? Please send me a message! 



Tools: Figma, Figjam, Adobe Creative Cloud, Adobe Creative Suite, Adobe XD, Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, Microsoft 365, MS Visio

Skills: UI/UX Design, User Experience (UX) Design, User Interface (UI) Design, Product Design, Interaction Design, Design Thinking, Lean UX, Design Sprint, Agile Scrum, Qualitative Research, Interviews, Observations, Quantitative Research, Research Synthesis, Empathy Mapping, Personas, Jobs-To-Be-Done (JTBD), User Journey, Research Presentation, User Stories, Site map, User Flows, Workshop facilitation, Low-fidelity prototyping, Sketching, Guerilla Testing, Mid-fidelity prototyping, Wireframes, Wireflows, High-fidelity prototyping, Design Systems, Component Library, Usability Testing

profile_positions.description:
BMO Automation is an innovative leader in CNC machine automation. BMO Automation makes robotic cells that provide input and output of raw materials, semi-finished and finished products. 

I collaborate with the CEO/Founder and a multidisciplinary team - Software engineers, Robot engineers, and mathematicians - On BMO Xenon - A software system to dramatically increase productivity on the production shop floor.

I am responsible for the UX Process. I conduct qualitative research such as interviews and observations at BMO Precision Parts - The manufacturing company within the BMO Group. I incorporate my insights into personas, Jobs-To-Be-Done, and User Journeys. 

I transition from problem to solution space via HMW Problem Statements. In addition, I facilitate workshops and create rapid -prototypes through sketches, wireframes, and clickable prototypes in Figma. I am also responsible for the BMO Design System, Component Library, and performing user testing.
profile_positions.title: UX/UI Designer

profile_positions.description:
CNC machine automation is technical and complex. There are many misunderstandings about the theory, terminology, and mathematical models. I am the author and graphic designer of the "BMO Technical Sales Manual," - A 168-page manual that contains all the information about automating CNC machines. 

The technical sales manual consists of two parts: 1) Automation Science and 2) Technical Information. The automation section includes topics such as automation types (Manned Production, Single Batch and Multi Batch), loading techniques (Product handling, Pallet handling, and Fixture exchange), product characteristics, and different selection models. Technical information consists of topics such as the BMO product portfolio, CNC-machine linkages, information on storage, gripper, and fixture systems, etc.

I have written all texts and graphic designs in Adobe InDesign. In addition, I developed all knowledge and skills about automation and CNC machines through interviews, observations, and walk-in days at BMO Precision Parts. I created the manual in close cooperation with the CEO/Founder.
profile_positions.title: Industrial Product Designer

profile_positions.description:
Both companies - BMO Precision Parts and BMO Automation - are growing rapidly. They developed their products quickly but never took the time to establish a brand identity. BMO had a certain brand identity but did not know what this identity entailed. There were no principles or guidelines established for the overall BMO brand.

I completed my Bachelor's degree as an Industrial Product Designer at BMO Automation. I conducted literature research on branding, marketing, and establishing distinctive brand elements during the project. In addition, I created the "BMO Brand Guidelines" document in collaboration with marketing. The document contains rules for applying layout, logo, typography, color, icons, graphics, and design. 

The BMO Brand Guidelines are currently used for various publications such as brochures, leaflets, stationery, internal/external presentations, booth design, etc.
profile_positions.title: Industrial Product Designer

profile_positions.description:
Mine Kafon Lab (MKL) has a mission: A world free of landmines. Mine Kafon Lab develops innovative products - Drones and robotics - to detect, analyze and defuse landmines. 

Mine Kafon Lab has two drones - MK Destiny and MK Manta. The MK Destiny can capture the position of landmines on a 3D map. In addition, the MK Manta has various "Robot Attachments" to defuse landmines. This simple detection and demining process implementation are at least 10x faster and 40x cheaper than current methods.

Mine Kafon was in transition from a start-up to a scalable company. I was responsible for the MK Assembly Guide. This document has all the technical details for assembling the MK Destiny, MK Manta, and various robotic attachments. 

I disassembled all Drones and Robot Attachments and, with proper documentation, reassembled them. I worked with a multi-disciplinary team of Mechanical, Software, Robot, and Electronic engineers during the project. 

The MK Assembly Guide is currently being used to assemble the Mine Kafon Drones and Robots.
profile_positions.title: Industrial Product Designer

profile_positions.description:
Massoud Hassani, CEO/Founder, is the designer of the Mine Kafon Ball. A wind-powered deminer. This functional artwork is located in the MoMA - Museum of Modern Arts, New York. Mine Kafon has already managed to reach millions of people through its mission through various national and international media channels such as CNN, BBS, Le Monde, ZDF, The Guardian, and Ted Talks.

Because of all the publicity, the sourcing process for interns was extremely competitive. Ultimately, I could distinguish myself and successfully pass the selection process.

I was responsible for developing a robotic attachment - The MK Seed Sprayer - for the agricultural industry. During the process, I applied a Rapid Prototyping process by sketching, 3D Modeling (Fusion 360), and 3D Printing (Ultimaker). During the process, there was intensive contact with local farmers for user testing and feedback. Eventually, in 6 months, the MK Seed Sprayer was developed.
profile_positions.title: Industrial Product Designer
